suffered us to err from thy ways, and to harden our heart. Isaiah asks why the Lord allowed his people to sin (6:9-10).

Return…the tribes of thine inheritance. Because of their sins, the seed of Abraham (the twelve tribes of Israel) have been separated from their promised blessings. Isaiah asks the Lord to help them to return to their promised inheritance.

for thy servants' sake. This phrase means "for the sake of those who are faithful." Even though many of the covenant people have turned to sin, Isaiah asks that the Lord remember his promises to them because of the worthiness of a few. This is the same argument Abraham made when the Lord informed him of the pending destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah (Gen. 18:23-24, 26).
